name: kreuzberg
description: A text extraction library supporting PDFs, images, office documents and more
readme_summary: Kreuzberg is a Python library providing an async interface for text extraction from diverse document formats.  It prioritizes local processing and minimal dependencies, making it suitable for RAG applications and resource-constrained environments.  Both single-item and batch processing are supported via async and sync APIs.
key_features: Unified async interface for text extraction
Supports various document formats (PDF, images, office documents)
Supports both async and sync APIs
Handles various text formats (Markdown, plain text, HTML, etc.)
primary_use_case: Text extraction from documents for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) applications

name: wild
description: A very fast linker for Linux
readme_summary: Wild is a linker aiming for speed in iterative development, currently supporting x86-64 Linux.  It produces various binary types and works with Rust proc-macros, although incremental linking and broader support are planned for the future.  It's intended as a faster alternative to other linkers during the development process.
key_features: Fast linking for iterative development (though not yet incremental)
primary_use_case: Faster build times during development of Rust code on x86-64 Linux systems

name: lume
description: A lightweight CLI and local API server to create, run and manage macOS and Linux virtual machines (VMs) natively on Apple Silicon.
readme_summary: Lume is a command-line interface and API server that simplifies the creation, management, and execution of virtual machines on Apple Silicon.  It leverages Apple's Virtualization.Framework for optimal performance and offers a range of commands for VM lifecycle management, configuration adjustments, and image handling.  A Python interface is also provided for programmatic control.
key_features: Lightweight CLI and local API server for managing macOS and Linux VMs
Near-native performance on Apple Silicon using Apple's Virtualization.Framework
Create, run, manage, and delete VMs
Modify VM configurations (CPU, memory, disk size, resolution)
Supports custom IPSW files for macOS VMs
Includes commands for listing, getting details, cloning, and pruning VMs
primary_use_case: Creating, running, and managing macOS and Linux virtual machines on Apple Silicon with near-native performance.

name: autogram
description: AI agent that automates AI news curation and post to Instagram
readme_summary: AutoGram is an AI agent that automatically collects and filters AI & tech news, generates branded images, and posts to Instagram.  It tracks performance, learns from engagement, and maintains brand consistency. The system uses Python, several AI services, and the Instagram API.
primary_use_case: Automates AI news curation and Instagram content management

name: DeepSeekPin
description: This lightweight Chrome extension lets you pin and manage your most important Deepseek chats for improved productivity, keeping them easily accessible at the top of your sidebar so you never have to scroll through your chat history again.
readme_summary: This Chrome extension enhances chat management in Deepseek by allowing users to pin important conversations for quick access.  It features a simple, lightweight design and seamless integration with Deepseek. The extension improves efficiency by eliminating the need to repeatedly search for specific chats.
key_features: Pin important chats for quick access
primary_use_case: Pinning chats in Deepseek for easy access

name: gridt
description: Gridt - A highly customizable CSS Grid overlay for web developers
readme_summary: Gridt is a customizable CSS grid overlay that allows developers to adjust various grid properties, attach it to different elements, and handle uneven grids.  It persists through hot reloads and offers options for visual customization.  The tool is designed to simplify the process of designing and debugging grid-based layouts.
key_features: Customizable columns, rows, grid gaps, and outside margin
Attachment to window or HTML element via CSS selectors
Support for custom grid-template-columns/rows for uneven grids
Adjustable line color and stroke width
primary_use_case: Providing a customizable CSS grid overlay for web developers to aid in grid-based layout design

name: python-magic
readme_summary: This Python library provides a wrapper around the libmagic library, enabling file type identification.  It offers functionalities like determining mime types and handling compressed files.  The library supports various operating systems and allows for customization through options like specifying the magic database file.
key_features: Option to specify magic database file
Uncompression support for compressed files such as gzip
primary_use_case: Identifying file types based on their content
